alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Walker, southeastern Winston and northeastern Fayette Counties through 1245 AM CST... At 1200 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Carbon Hill, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Carbon Hill, Arley, Sipsey, Kansas, Nauvoo, Eldridge, Curry, Camp McDowell, Smith Dam, Smith Lake, Poplar Springs, Helicon, Falls City, Lynns Park, Mill Branch, Maple Branch, Little Dismal Creek, Yellow Creek and Coon Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
